title: Official : Poland weighs shooting down Russian missiles near border
message:
Poland is considering whether to involve its air defenses in shooting down Russian missiles over Ukrainian territory, Polish Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Pawel Wronski told Ukrinform on May 22.
President Volodymyr Zelensky said in an interview with Reuters on May 20 that Western allies, including Poland, could intervene more directly in Ukraine's defense by shooting down Russian missiles.
According to Wronski, the Polish government has been discussing the legal ramifications of shooting down Russian missiles since this incident.
Wronski clarified that Poland is not considering transferring any of its air defense units to Ukraine.
There is no possibility of the Polish air defence system being outside the country's borders," he said.
event_breakdown:
1. Poland is considering whether to involve its air defenses in shooting down Russian missiles over Ukrainian territory.
2. Poland has been discussing the legal ramifications of shooting down Russian missiles since this event occurred.
3. Poland is not considering transferring any of its air defense units to Ukraine.

message:

title: Satirical joke about Mossad agent  Eli Kopter  behind Iranian president crash fools French TV analyst , Hamas
message:
A French TV channel reported there was a "rumor" that Iranian President Ebraim Raisi was killed by Israeli agent "Eli Kopter" after jokes about the fictitious character went viral and fooled Hamas.
"People are saying the helicopter pilot was an Israeli Mossad Agent named Eli Kopter," the Hamas-affiliated Telegram channel "Al-Qassam Correspondent" said.

title: Everything is burning : Battles rage outside Kharkiv as Ukraine tries to hold back Russian advance
message:
Russia’s relentless onslaught has a key goal: If they take Lyptsi, then they can position artillery within range of Ukraine’s second city, Kharkiv, 20 minutes down the road.
“They’re not sending just anyone into the assaults.”His stare lengthens when asked about what fortifications were in place before the surprise Russian attack.
At one position closer to the Russian border, the 92nd Assault Brigade showed CNN a Russian artillery gun, captured in the first days of the war, from which they are now firing French mortar shells.
The gun was partially hidden by a wire net, aimed at providing some protection from an attack drone.
Attacks persisted in the distance however, keeping the city’s residents awake through violently loud nights, now amplified by the threat of Russian artillery edging closer.
event_breakdown:
Security events reported in this text are as follows:

1. Russia's relentless onslaught in Ukraine, with a goal to take Lyptsi and establish artillery within range of Ukraine's second city Kharkiv.
2. The use of Russian artillery guns to attack Ukraine's positions and capture French mortar shells in the first days of the war.
3. The ongoing attacks by Russian forces on Ukraine's positions in Kharkiv, keeping the city's residents awake through violently loud nights.
4. The threat of Russian artillery edging closer to Kharkiv, as evidenced by the presence of captured Russian artillery guns aimed at providing protection from attack drones.

title: Editorial : Unacceptable Parity Between Hamas , Israel
message:
Israel-Hamas War | File ImageThe seeming equivalence sought to be imposed by the International Criminal Court between the terrorist organisation Hamas and Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, to say the very least, is outrageous.
Whatever be the excesses and collateral damage of Israel’s armed action against Hamas following its October 7 massacre of innocents in Israel, it does not warrant parity between the two.
While conceding that Israel had the right to protect its citizens, the ICC charge said that Netanyahu’s action against Hamas involved “starvation as a method of war”.
Besides, the other petro-dollar-rich Arab nations were unwilling to shelter the Gaza civilians till IDF waged a war to the finish against Hamas.
That Israel is not a signatory of the Rome Declaration setting up ICC further absolves its leaders from obeying its dictate.

title: Ukrainian forces shoot down another Russian Su - 25 aircraft
message:
Ukrainian troops destroyed a Russian Su-25 attack aircraft near Pokrovsk in Donetsk Oblast on May 22, the General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces said in an operational update.
This is the fifth Russian Su-25 jet that Ukraine has shot down this month.
The Soviet-designed Su-25, nicknamed "Frogfoot" by NATO, is a heavily armored ground-attack aircraft that provides close air support for Russian ground troops.
"According to available information, Ukrainian troops destroyed a Russian Su-25 attack aircraft," the General Staff reported.
The General Staff said on May 18 that Russia has lost over 350 planes since the launch of the full-scale invasion.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Ukrainian troops destroyed a Russian Su-25 attack aircraft near Pokrovsk in Donetsk Oblast on May 22.
Event 2: The General Staff reported that this is the fifth Russian Su-25 jet Ukraine has shot down this month.

title: Man Charged with Stabbing at Anaheim Business
message:
A 44-year-old Garden Grove man is facing attempted murder charges for a stabbing attack in Anaheim earlier this month, police said Wednesday.
Gilbert David Marquez was charged last week with attempted murder with sentencing enhancements for the personal use of a deadly weapon and inflicting great bodily injury on the victim.
Marquez was accused of stabbing the man at a business in the 400 block of South Euclid Street on May 1, police said.
Police responded to a hospital at about 6 a.m. that day regarding the victim, authorities said.
The defendant was arrested Friday in downtown Anaheim, police said.
event_breakdown:
* May 1: Stabbing attack in Anaheim, California, United States.
* May 1: Victim of the stabbing attack hospitalized.
* May 6: Suspect Gilbert David Marquez arrested and charged with attempted murder.

title: Montreal Police Arrest Muslim Suspect In Connection With Shots Fired At Yeshiva Gedolah Of Montreal
message:
A 20-year-old suspect, Abdirazak Mahdi Ahmed, was arrested and charged on Wednesday in connection with shots fired at a Jewish school in the Côte-des-Neiges—Notre-Dame-de-Grâce borough last fall.
This incident was the second shooting at the yeshiva in just four days, following shots fired at it and the Talmud Torah on St-Kevin Ave. overnight.
The week prior, Molotov cocktails were thrown at a shul and Jewish community center in the West Island.

“This attack marked a significant change in the threats experienced by the Jewish community in Quebec since Oct. 7 and well before,” Yudin said.

title: Lockerbie Verdict Vindicates Continued Sanctions Against Libya
message:
The outcome of the Lockerbie bombing trial underscores the need for a firm U.S. policy toward Libyan dictator Muammar Qadhafi.
The U.N. Security Council imposed sanctions on Libya in 1992 because of Qadhafi's refusal to extradite the two Libyans accused of organizing the Lockerbie bombing.
The Clinton Administration's priority in agreeing to the Lockerbie trial arrangements was to rehabilitate Libya rather than to pursue justice.
All of these should be maintained, including the 1996 Iran and Libya Sanctions Act, which penalizes foreign oil companies that invest in the oil and gas industries of Libya or Iran.
Although Libya sacrificed one of its intelligence agents in the Lockerbie trial, it did so to lift sanctions that threatened Qadhafi's rule.

- U.S. policy toward Qadhafi

title: Missile splashes into the Red Sea , causing no damage in latest suspected Yemen Houthi rebel attack
message:
(AP Photo)DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A missile splashed down in the waters of the Red Sea on Thursday, but caused no damage to a passing commercial vessel in an attack likely carried out by Yemen's Houthi rebels, officials said.
The Houthis did not immediately claim the attack, though it can take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their assaults.
The attack happened in the southern Red Sea near the crucial Bab el-Mandeb Strait, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden has declined because of the threat.
In recent weeks, the tempo of Houthi attacks has dropped, though the rebels have claimed shooting down U.S. surveillance drones.

title: Israel to Restart Gaza Talks After Hostage Video Sparks Outrage
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Israel said it would revive stalled cease-fire talks with Hamas after social media video showing female Israeli soldiers being abducted by the militants on Oct. 7 sparked a public outcry.
The women, who Israel confirmed are military personnel, were kidnapped when Hamas invaded Israel and killed 1,200 people.
The attack triggered an Israeli military response that’s destroyed much of Gaza and killed more than 35,000 Palestinians.
In a statement, Hamas said the video showed “deliberate distortions” and dismissed the women’s injuries as “something to be expected.” The statement didn’t address the talks.

5. Hamas takes four soldier hostage and shares a video of the incident on social media.

title: Israeli forces kill dozens of Palestinians as they push deeper in Gaza north and south
message:
Israeli forces kill dozens of Palestinians as they push deeper in Gaza’s north and southreuters_tickers3 minutesBy Nidal al-MughrabiCAIRO (Reuters) – Israeli forces killed 35 Palestinians in aerial and ground bombardments across the Gaza Strip on Thursday and battled in close combat with Hamas-led militants in areas of the southern city of Rafah, health officials and Hamas media said.
Israeli tanks advanced in Rafah’s southeast, edged towards the city’s western district of Yibna and continued to operate in three eastern suburbs, residents said.
“The occupation (Israeli forces) is trying to move further to the west, they are on the edge of Yibna, which is densely populated.
Moreover, the troops located and dismantled a number of terror tunnel shafts and launchers in the area, and eliminated several terrorists during close-quarters encounters,” the Israeli military statement added.
Since then, Israel’s assault in Gaza has killed more than 35,000 people, with thousands more feared buried under the rubble, according to Gaza health authorities.
event_breakdown: Israeli forces killed 35 Palestinians in aerial and ground bombardments across the Gaza Strip. Israeli forces battled in close combat with Hamas-led militants in Rafah, in the southern Gaza Strip. Israeli tanks advanced in Rafah's southeast, edged towards Yibna in the west, and in three eastern suburbs.

title: Ukraine updates : Russia Kharkiv push displaces thousands – DW – 05 / 23 / 2024
message:
Ukraine's governor of the Kharkiv region said on Thursday that 10,980 people in total had fled their homes in the roughly two weeks since Russia launched an attack on a line that had long been static at ground level.
Across the border in Belgorod, a missile alert warning sounded overnight and Russia's Defense Ministry reported several intercepted projectiles and drones.

This comes amid the latest domestic dispute over spending in Berlin, this time pertaining to a new permanent force of Bundeswehr soldiers stationed in Lithuania.
Follow DW for a roundup of major stories related to Russia's war on Ukraine on May 23, 2024

.

title: Half a Russian Buk Missile Battalion Destroyed , Ukrainian Special Ops Say
message:
Operators of the 3rd Separate Regiment of the Special Operations Forces (SSO) destroyed half a battalion of Russian Buk anti-aircraft missile systems in three weeks, Ukraine’s SSO reported on its Telegram channel.
A standard Buk battalion (divizion) consists of a command vehicle, target acquisition radar vehicle, six transporter erector launcher and radar vehicles, and three transporter erector launcher vehicles.
The report does not specify in which operational sector the Russian Buks were destroyed.
However, it does indicate that three anti-aircraft missile complexes were hit by SSO fighters at the end of April and beginning of May, and the fourth Buk was destroyed by special ops a few days ago.
“The result of the SSO’s successful work is the burning remains of scrapped Russian steel,” read the caption to the published footage.
location: Based on the context provided, I was unable to come up with an answer.

Event 1: Russian Buk anti-aircraft missile systems battalion was destroyed by the SSO fighters in three weeks.
Event 2: SSO destroyed the Russian Buks at the end of April and the beginning of May.
Event 3: Special ops fighters destroyed the fourth Buk a few days ago.

title: Missile splashes into the Red Sea , causing no damage in latest suspected Yemen Houthi rebel attack
message:
Missile splashes into the Red Sea, causing no damage in latest suspected Yemen Houthi rebel attackDUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A missile splashed down in the waters of the Red Sea on Thursday, but caused no damage to a passing commercial vessel in an attack likely carried out by Yemen's Houthi rebels, officials said.
The Houthis did not immediately claim the attack, though it can take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their assaults.
The attack happened in the southern Red Sea near the crucial Bab el-Mandeb Strait, the British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Shipping through the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden has declined because of the threat.
In recent weeks, the tempo of Houthi attacks has dropped, though the rebels have claimed shooting down U.S. surveillance drones.
event_breakdown:
1. Missile splashed down into waters of the Red Sea on Thursday, but caused no damage to a passing commercial vessel.
2. Attack likely carried out by Yemen's Houthi rebels.
3. British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center reported the attack happened in southern Red Sea near Bab el-Mandeb Strait.
4. Shipping through the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden has declined due to the threat.
5. tempo of Houthi attacks has dropped in recent weeks, though the rebels have claimed shooting down U.S. surveillance drones.

title: 1 killed , 3 wounded in Israeli strike on southern Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, May 23 (Xinhua) -- A Hezbollah official was killed and three civilians were injured on Thursday in an Israeli airstrike on a civilian car on a road in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources said.
The shrapnel hit the passing school bus, killing the Hezbollah official, who also worked as a physics teacher, and injuring three students.
According to the sources, civil defense members extinguished the fire that broke out in the car and transported the wounded to a hospital in the city of Nabatieh.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.
Confrontations between Hezbollah and Israel have killed 482 people on the Lebanese side, including 306 Hezbollah members and 89 civilians, according to Lebanese security sources.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Thursday, a Hezbollah official was killed and three civilians were injured in an Israeli airstrike in a civilian car on a road in southern Lebanon.
Event 2: Israel retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.While one Hezbollah official was killed by Israeli report, another Hezbollah official, who also worked as a physics teacher, was killed as a result of the wreckage of a passing school bus.

title: Somalia : UN Sanctions Three Al - Shabaab Leaders At Request of Somali Government
message:
New York — In a significant move to combat terrorism, the United Nations Security Council has sanctioned three leaders of the Al-Shabaab militant group following a request from the Somali government.
The decision was made public on May 23, 2024, and targets three individuals identified as key figures in the organization:1.
The Somali government has been working closely with international partners, including the United Nations, to combat Al-Shabaab, a group known for its violent attacks and control over parts of the country.
The sanctions are a significant step forward in this ongoing battle, demonstrating the international community's commitment to supporting Somalia's efforts to eradicate terrorism.
As of now, the impact of these sanctions on Al-Shabaab's operations and the response from the group remains to be seen.

title: Russia Hits Kharkiv With Missile Strikes , Killing at Least Six
message:
Russia Hits Kharkiv With Missile Strikes, Killing at Least Six(Bloomberg) -- Russian forces hit Kharkiv and the nearby town of Lyubotyn with a barrage of at least 15 simultaneous missile strikes on Thursday, stepping up pressure against Ukraine’s second-largest city.
The attack killed at least six civilians and wounded another 16, regional governor Oleh Synehubov said on Telegram.
S-300 missiles damaged local transport infrastructure as well as a printing facility in Kharkiv, setting off a large fire, according to Telegram reports from Synehubov and city mayor Ihor Terekhov.
Russian forces are taking advantage of insufficient air defense and Ukraine’s lack of capability to destroy missile launchers located near its borders, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in a statement on social platform X.Kremlin troops opened a new front in the Kharkiv region this month, putting additional pressure on Ukraine’s increasingly fragile defenses.
©2024 Bloomberg L.P.
event_breakdown:
1. Russian forces launch a barrage of at least 15 simultaneous missile strikes on Kharkiv and the nearby town of Lyubotyn.
2. The attack killed at least six civilians and wounded another 16 in Kharkiv and Lyubotyn.
3. Russian troops open a new front in the Kharkiv region this month.
4. Russian military takes advantage of insufficient air defense in Ukraine.
5. Missiles damage local transport infrastructure and a printing facility in Kharkiv and set off a large fire.

message:
Beirut/Tel Aviv, May 23 : Israel said on Thursday it had killed a commander of the pro-Iranian Hezbollah militia in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah confirmed the death but did not specify the man's rank.
Hezbollah said that it had fired "dozens of rockets" at Israeli targets in northern Israel in retaliation.
Since the beginning of the war in the Gaza Strip, there have been daily military confrontations between the Israeli army and the Hezbollah militia and other groups in the border area between Israel and Lebanon.
The exchanges of fire have caused severe destruction in towns on both sides of the border.

title: Russia warns it will strike British targets  in Ukraine and beyond  - forcing NATO to enter the conflict - if united kingdom weapons are used for attacks within its territory
message:
Moscow will retaliate with strikes on British targets if weapons from the UK are used by Ukraine to attack Russian territory, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova declared today.

title: Israeli Minister Gantz in favour of official probe into October 7
message:
Tel Aviv, May 24 : Benny Gantz, a Minister in the Israeli war Cabinet, has spoken out in favour of a commission of inquiry to clarify how the terrorist attack on October 7 could have happened.
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu earlier denied in a statement that he had received warnings from the military about a possible attack from the Gaza Strip.
Gantz threatened to resign from the government at the weekend if Netanyahu did not present a post-war plan for the Gaza Strip by June 8.
The Gaza war began with the terrorist attack by the Palestinian Islamist Hamas movement on Israel on October 7.
In the unprecedented massacre by Hamas and other extremist groups, around 1,200 people were killed and more than 250 were taken hostage in the Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown:
Security Events:

1. The attack by the terrorist group Hamas on Israel on October 7.

title: Sudan El Fasher battle : Satellite images of Darfur show RSF destruction
message:
The satellite images analysed by Yale University's Humanitarian Research Lab (HRL) show how the RSF is targeting civilian dwellings in and around El Fasher, the army’s last stronghold in Darfur.
“In Darfur and El Fasher, civilians are being attacked and killed because of the colour of their skin, because of their ethnicity,” Alice Wairimu Nderitu told the UN Security Council on Tuesday, external.
El Fasher resident Ibrahim al-Tayeb al-Faki said his sister was killed in a military airstrike that had also destroyed his home.
“There is no safe place in El Fasher right now,” he said.
El Fasher residents say that access to food and water has become increasingly difficult.
event_breakdown:
1. Darfur and El Fasher residents are being attacked by security forces due to their ethnicity.
2. Residents of El Fasher have been targeted and killed in a military operation which has also resulted in the destruction of their homes.
3. The residents of El Fasher are also facing difficulties in accessing food and water.

title: 4 - year - old girl dies in hospital after being injured in Russian attack on Odesa on 29 April
message:
A child died in hospital on 23 May due to the Russian missile attack on Odesa on 29 April.
Source: Oleh Kiper, Head of Odesa Oblast Military Administration, on TelegramQuote: "Unfortunately, the death toll from the Russian attack on 29 April has increased to eight people.
Today, 4-year-old Zlata died in hospital after a fragment of a Russian missile hit her heart.
Our doctors fought until the end..."Background:On 29 April, Russian forces launched a missile attack on Odesa.
On 8 May, a man who was injured in a Russian missile attack on Odesa on 29 April died in hospital.

Security events:
- Russian missile attack on Odesa, April 29
- Injury of a man who was injured in the missile attack, May 8

title: At least 12 Palestinians killed in Israeli airstrike on aid distribution center in Gaza - Xinhua
message:
GAZA, May 23 (Xinhua) -- At least 12 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli airstrike targeting an aid distribution center in central Gaza, Palestinian security and medical sources said Thursday.
Security sources told Xinhua that an Israeli aircraft targeted the center in the east of Deir al-Balah city with a missile.
The bodies of the dead, along with several other wounded, had been transported to the Al-Aqsa Hospital in the city, medical sources said.
The majority of the population in the Gaza Strip suffer from a lack of food, medicine, and basic humanitarian needs since the outbreak of the war.
UN agencies have warned of dire consequences in the enclave, including famine and the spread of epidemics and diseases among the local population.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: An Israeli aircraft targeted an aid distribution center in central Gaza.
Event 2: 12 Palestinians were killed in the Israeli airstrike.
Event 3: The bodies of the dead, along with several other wounded, had been transported to the Al-Aqsa Hospital in the city.

title: Israel launches deadly Gaza strikes , says ready for new truce talks
message:

The Gaza Strip's civil defence agency said two pre-dawn air strikes had killed 26 people, including 15 children, in Gaza City.

title: CIA Director Burns heads to Europe to kickstart stalled Gaza truce talks : report
message:
May 23, 2024CIA Director Bill Burns will meet in Europe with his Israeli counterpart, David Barnea, in the coming days in a bid to revive stalled indirect negotiations between Israel and Hamas.
Burns has been the lead US negotiator trying to broker a truce between the two warring sides in recent months.
Speaking at a press conference Thursday evening, Israeli military spokesperson Daniel Hagari addressed the five kidnapped female soldiers directly: “We have failed to protect you, your friends and many other Israeli citizens and soldiers.
The Israeli military did not confirm Palestinian reports earlier in the day of Israeli troops operating in the Yabna refugee camp further to the west.
The International Court of Justice will make its decision based on a case brought by South Africa against the Israeli military campaign in Gaza.

1. CIA Director Bill Burns will meet with his Israeli counterpart, David Barnea, in Europe in the coming days to try to revive stalled indirect negotiations between Israel and Hamas.

3. The International Court of Justice will make a decision based on a case brought by South Africa against the Israeli military campaign in Gaza.
